channel.title: I need someone to help me! Please look!
channel.description:
In the "how to create a server" thread (http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,285415.0.html) i did everything, but when i got to the part at end where it said "if your server isn't still up, try opening up your ports 43594 in firewall/router" well i went to my firewall overview and than to firewall, but i couldn't find 43594 port in the list that was populated. I need help, i did everything but my server still doesn't work because i think its because of the ports.
Other information: I have a firewall broadband router, and i use a access point for my computer only (the one that im trying to make the server with). Do i have to do something with the router? Because than ill have to change options, details in my other computer with the router connected, and i don't know anything about that.
Please help, Thanks

item.source: I need someone to help me! Please look!

item.title: I need someone to help me! Please look!
item.dc:creator: @Blackened46 Blackened46
item.description:
@Blackened46 wrote:

1.If you have a router then open up an internet browser and type either Http://192.168.0.1 or for some people its Http://192.168.0.0 (the first one usually works)

  1. log into your router, after that has been done find port forwarding.

3.Once you have reached this step, type in the private ip address of the computer your useing

  1. if you do not know how to do this click start, ‘run’ and type cmd and click ok.

  2. in the command prompt type ‘ipconfig’ and you should see an ip address that looks similar to ‘192.186.0.130’ the last three numbers will be different than ‘130’.

6.after you have done that enter TDC and UDP ports as 43594, if you only have one place to inter a port then put it in as 43594 and make sure the firewall for it is set to allow.

  1. save this and and it should work if your windows firewall settings are on your can try the next step.

  2. if your running a windows operating system you can also try adding a port into your firewall settings, you shouldnt have to but just incase try this.

  3. click start and open up your network connections.

10.under network task on the top right side of your network connections click ‘change windows firewall settings’.

  1. in the general tab of windows firewall make sure dont allow execption is NOT checked if the firewall is on.

  2. next click the exeptions tap at the top.

13.click ‘add port’ at the bottom of the screen and give it anyname you wish and put the port number as ‘43594’ and click ‘TCP’

  1. click ok and your done this should work

Read full topic
